abstract: Microsoft is starting to test a package that includes the home version of Office and its OneCare anti-virus service that it will sell as a subscription. The company won’t say how much it wants to charge, so we look at its options including giving the software away free with ads.
snippet: Microsoft is starting to test a package that includes the home version of Office and its OneCare anti-virus service that it will sell as a subscription. The company won’t say how much it wants to charge, so we look at its options including giving ...
lead_paragraph: Microsoft said  Friday that it was going to start testing a subscription service that combines its OneCare anti-virus package, the home version of its Office suite, and some other features in one package, called Albany, to be sold by subscription.

headline.main: How Much Should Microsoft Charge for Its Home Software Subscription?
